name: Karen M. AUGER v. John J. MORAN, Director, Department of Corrections

parties: Karen M. AUGER v. John J. MORAN, Director, Department of Corrections.

opinions.text:
ORDER
The respondent is directed to file his answer to the petition for writ of habeas corpus and therein to show cause, if any he has, why the petition should not be granted, said answer to be made in compliance with the provisions of Rule 14.
3

attorneys: Longolucco, Lenihan & Orsinger, John M. McLoughlin, Wakefield, for petitioner.
Dennis J. Roberts II, Atty. Gen., Melanie W. Spencer, Sp. Asst. Atty. Gen., for respondent.
casebody.head_matter:
Karen M. AUGER v. John J. MORAN, Director, Department of Corrections.
No. 80-170-M.P.
Supreme Court of Rhode Island.
April 17, 1980.
Longolucco, Lenihan & Orsinger, John M. McLoughlin, Wakefield, for petitioner.
Dennis J. Roberts II, Atty. Gen., Melanie W. Spencer, Sp. Asst. Atty. Gen., for respondent.
